newsitem.title: USA: Ford to hold line on 1998 model prices - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Ford to hold line on 1998 model prices - WSJ.

text.p: Reflecting consumer resistance to higher prices, Ford Motor Co is expected today to announce it will hold the line on 1998 model prices, The Wall Street Journal said.

In Friday's electronic edition, the paper cited "individuals close to the company" who said Robert Rewey, group vice president for sales, service and marketing, at a mid-day news briefing would outline a marketing program that involves essentially flat pricing for 1998 models.
Stiffening competition, particularly from the Japanese, and market softness are forcing price moderation on auto makers, the article said.
